description.narrative: Oxfam and partner will intervene in Adamawa State and will prioritize EFSL/WaSH activities towards relieving the impact of food insecurity as well as preventing vector-based related diseases for IDPs and host families as well as increasing their resilience. The intervention will employ distribution of food and NFIs for immediate relief to IDPs. The intervention will focus on IDPs in host communities and those living in informal settlements around Yola and its environs. Families hosting IDPs within the communities will also be considered. The intervention will target 4000 HHs. The support will: # ensure that all individuals (particularly women and children) displaced and affected by the conflict receive effective and quality humanitarian assistance. # Increase the resilience of thehost communities by providing support to their livelihoods (production and productivity), which will contribute in making them lessvulnerable and more self-reliant as they integrate IDPs . # Support and facilitate an enabling condition for the IDPs for their safe return to their place of origin, if the precondition (safety, security and political stability) are in place. The WASH interventions that will be carried out will aim at improving access to sanitation and safe drinking water as well as hygiene promotion. OXFAM will distribute basic NFI, such as jerry cans and basic hygiene material. The WaSH implementation will include sensitization on hygiene behaviours and will emphasize provision of sanitation facilities for most vulnerable households. In addition, Oxfam WASH implementation will include temporary and/or sustainable solutions for supplying sufficient, safe WASH facilities to the impacted population. This will target repairs and rehabilitation of community water points, community-based hygiene promotion, complemented with construction of gender-sensitive sanitation facilities. Hygiene education will promote key good hygiene practices, including the use of latrines and proper hand washing at critical times. Oxfamintends to provide agricultural inputs and technical support to host familiesand IDPs able to secure land in their area of displacement. In this regards female and male affected farmers will receive improved farm inputs to support immediate farm production. The support will also include extensions services to the beneficiaries. The intervention will integrate protection with emphasis on mitigating gender based violence issues, conflict sensitivity and support to the community resilience. Oxfam will ensure that its EFSL and WASH activities mainstream gender. This project make part of the Lake Chad Basin crisis response.

participating-org.narrative: Civil Society Coalition for Poverty Eradication (CISCOPE) is a coalition grouping of over 130 Nigerian Civil Society Organizations.There are at least three civil society member organizations of CISCOPE in each state of the federation. Founded in 2002, CISCOPE was formed in response to the need for a national platform for organizing Civil Society input into the Nigerian Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper (PRSP). It was also a response to the belief at the time that individual Nigerian NGOs did not have sufficient capacity to undertake meaningful development and humanitarian work, and that by pooling their resources together they were in a better position to make qualitative contributions in national topical discussions that will enhance the livelihood of the poor and vulnerable in the society as well as respond to the needs of victims of humanitarian disasters. Driven by the vision of poverty # free Nigerian Society, CISCOPE strives to facilitate civil society participation in public processes and influence them in favour of the poor and marginalized. In this regard, CISCOPE engages all levels of government (federal, state and local) as well as institutions for policy and decision - making on vital social sector services such as education, health, agriculture, Emergency Food Security and Livelivelihood etc.
